titleStmt.title: You fired the shot
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman
titleStmt.sponsor: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities, University of Nebraska-Lincoln
titleStmt.funder: The National Endowment for the Humanities

address.addrLine: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive.

notesStmt.note: This manuscript consists of two lines of a draft of a poem beginning "You fired the shot." The lines have no known connection to any of Whitman's published poetry. Based on the handwriting, Edward Grier dates this manuscript to the 1850s (Notebooks and Unpublished Prose Manuscripts [New York: New York University Press, 1984], 1:320).

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Free cider and Long Island character
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.
On the same side of the leaf as well as on the reverse side are prose notes about Long Island. Whitman sectioned off the poetic lines from the prose notes with a horizontal line.

revisionDesc.change: created file, extracting information from transcription file for loc.00156

lg.l: You fired the shot—now I bring them back to you
Here are the blows you gave me.—
